newsitem.title: AFGHANISTAN: Air raid hits Taleban-held Afghan capital.
newsitem.headline: Air raid hits Taleban-held Afghan capital.

text.p: At least one opposition warplane bombed Kabul overnight as Taleban fighters poured anti-aircraft fire into the night sky to try to drive off the attackers.

There was no immediate word on casualties from the raid, which took place at about 9:30 p.m. (1700 GMT) and appeared to have hit an eastern part of the Afghan capital. The evening sky lit up as fighters of the purist Islamic Taleban militia fired anti-aircraft guns and even Kalashnikov assault rifles skywards in a noisy barrage.
The Taleban, who captured Kabul in September, have been forced onto the defensive in the past few weeks after suffering humiliating defeats in opposition-held northern Afghanistan.
